alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson; Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 27 at 5:26PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT/645 PM CDT/ FOR SOUTHEASTERN YUMA COUNTY IN NORTHEASTERN COLORADO...EASTERN KIT CARSON COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL COLORADO... SOUTHWESTERN CHEYENNE AND SHERMAN COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS... At 525 PM MDT/625 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of St. Francis to 12 miles north of Ruleton to 6 miles northeast of Burlington, moving south at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Kanorado, Ruleton and Goodland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 32. Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 433 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 172 and 219. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. These thunderstorms will produce damaging winds resulting in areas of near zero visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility.
